intro: Triplandra lanata, commonly known as the hairy triplandra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs that help reduce water loss. The flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in dense inflorescences.
